text: Freezing wind shutters through the shadows.  Relentless darkness.  No sign of life, save for -- The SOUND of determined footsteps.

The doorman at his post flipping through a magazine, rap music pounding from his radio. Glass suddenly shatters as a gloved hand punches through the window, reaching in, unlocking the front door. Two men in dark suits blur inside.  The doorman rushes to stop them, only -- DEX, the taller of the two men, slams the barrel of his gun into the doorman's throat.
Life can be an illusion. (low and deadly)

Sometimes we see what isn't there, and sometimes we don't see what is there. The doorman, wide eyed with terror, nods his consent. Dex removes the gun. Doorman plants himself in the chair, eyes glued to his magazine, making it clear he doesn't 'see' the men as the stroll into --
Old fashioned steel box struggling its way up the shaft. Fluorescent yellow light stabbing through the grating.
Dex slaps a small plastic strip on an apartment door as both men turn away, shielding their eyes. A blinding flash of light as the door is blown apart.
The men rush inside and straight into --
Candles flicker on the dresser.  A syringe on the bedside table, next to a sleeping figure curled up under the sheets. Both men starting to pull guns, but --

This one's personal. Dex's partner shrugs, holsters his weapon and steps back through the doorway, watching as -- Dex spins and fires. Not the traditional booming gunfire, but rather the strange sound of electronic hissing as laser-fire rips th person to shreds. Dex finally stops firing and moves to the bed to verify the kill, only on close inspection he sees it's not a person. He's just blown the hell out of a MANNEQUIN. Dex smiles, blows out the candle and heads out of the room.

A lone PRIEST lights the sacrament candles, the sound of his breathing reverberating through the empty church. He suddenly stops, snaps his head around -- A man in a wheelchair stares at him from the doorway. The man is CHRISTOPH.  Dark robes shroud his shriveled, decaying body but his eyes still burn with life.
(raspy voice which labors to be heard)
May I trouble you with a confession? Even in the flickering half-light of the candles, the Priest can see that Christoph is dying.
Never a trouble. The large statue of Jesus over the alter staring down as the Priest leads Christoph into --
Christoph's voice is weak, knowing each word could be the last.
Forgive me Father, for I have coveted.
What have you coveted?
(anguished whisper)
Life. A small smile of compassion escapes across the Priest's lips.
God gave us all the need for life. And when the end begins to near, we all crave more time.  No sin.
(hesitantly)
But there's what I would do for more time.

What would you do -- A sharp hissing sound -- The laser burns through the confessional wall and straigh through the priest's chest. Face frozen in a listening pose as the body crumples to death. Christoph slowly lowers his weapon with a look of genuine contrition.

It's the near future and the neighborhood is covered with graffiti scrawled in machine code and billboards projecting holographs advertising malt liquor and pleasure-dipped cigarettes. A slick-black JET COPTER drops silently from the sky.

Pieces of advanced computer technology lie scattered abou the large work table.  A small kitchen and bedroom in the back. Speakers pour in one of Handel's aching melodies. The music suddenly pierced by the shriek of a giant Bird of Prey diving across the room.

A tight knot of bodyguards disgorge from the copter. Tense eyes sweeping the street, they finally give the all clear signal. HALDEN, a charismatic bull of a man, emerges from the copter.  He moves with the confidence of someone who know he can't be touched.

The sound of Handel's concert mixes with the sound of claws tearing apart flesh. TANNER sits in the middle of the room.  He is early forties, athletic build, and a face that holds too many memories. His insomniac-stained eyes studying the Holographic Chess Board as the knight mounted on the Bird of Prey slaughter a pawn.
Visitors. Tanner snaps his attention to --
Halden and his men head toward the warehouse.
Tanner's eyes harden at the sight of Halden.  A long beat then he finally shakes his head in resigned disgust.
Permit entry. The sound of dead bolts automatically sliding open.
The bodyguards stand motionless in the corner, doing thei best to look like furniture. Halden moves through the holographic chess board, his eye on Tanner.
A legend fell tonight. His stare now ripping into Tanner.
The unrunnable maze.  Impossible to get through. (thick smile)
Well, some kid just danced it like it was some six bit video game. Tanner doesn't blink.  His voice matter-of-fact.
He had keys.
Of course the legend would like to think that.  But no one has keys. (fierce)
Your maze was run.
Halden and his men escort Tanner to the waiting copter.

Christoph stands naked in the middle of the vacant street staring down at himself in reverent awe. It is as if he's been reborn.  His body no longer decrepit, but rather pulsing with an almost inhuman vitality. He heads down the street, the walk becoming a run, then a sprint, his head back, mouth open, tasting the wind.
A jet-copter screams across the night sky, while inside -

Tanner studies the holographic image of the maze projecte in front of him: A constantly shifting sea of lines swirling furiously in random directions. A small BLUE SQUARE rockets into the maze.  Sound of laughter as the square dodges, feints, spinning it's way down into -- The center of the maze.  A pattern so intricate it seems to be a solid wall of light with no way through -- Only the square suddenly shoots up, twisting, somehow finding the smallest of fissures and blurring through. The square is gone.  Only the laughter remains.
He had fun ripping your maze, that's good. (tight smile)
Now that it's obsolete for security purposes, maybe we can turn it into an amusement ride. Tanner silently snaps off the hologram as the jet-copter banks sharply for a landing onto --
A towering black monolith which seems to burst straight u through the heavens.

Halden leads Tanner down the long hall. Dex, who has traded his dark "assassin's" suit for a VSI standard issue gray pin-stripe, stands waiting for them. He keeps his eyes on Halden, as if Tanner wasn't even there.
We just tracked the runner to the hotel district. Halden nods as all three of them head into --
Long rows of programming consoles manned by engineers wearing wireless 'tele-com' headsets. Dex directs Halden's attention to one of the high-def monitors lining the walls.  The monitor showing --
Rock music pounds the room as silver confetti drops from the ceiling. A KID, sixteen at most, watches excitedly from the bed as the two Playmates, Barbie-Doll bodies, slow-dance a striptease.
Dex finally acknowledges Tanner's presence.
Still going through puberty and he shreds your maze. (hard)
That's gotta hurt. Tanner remains silent.  Eyes locked on the monitor as Halden turns to EMMA, VSI's senior security engineer.
Get some internal police there. Tell them to run a perimeter.

But have them wait for me 'till they move in on him. Halden turns, shooting him a surprised look.  But Tanner ignores it as he heads for the door. Dex goes to stop him, but something in Tanner's eyes make him think twice about it. A frozen beat, then Halden snaps a silent command to Dex to let Tanner go.

Rows and rows of unconscious bodies strapped to interface seats, the room looks like a warehouse full of people in comas. Tanner climbs into an interface seat as a TECHNICIAN wheels up his medi-cart and starts preparing an IV.
Shouldn't be in that long. The technician shrugs, returns the IV to his cart and starts hooking Tanner to a bio-monitor. Dex strides into the room, staring down at Tanner.
Been a while since you've been inside. (off Tanner's silence)
Going to look up old friends? Tanner meets Dex's stare.  A deadly exchange.
(grins)
You know she asks about you all the time -- Tanner plunges his finger into the CONNECT BOX, his eyes thrusting back in his head, body going slack.
Cool silent blackness of the void. Eternal stretch of nothingness. Then the blink of a light racing toward us. Colors so intense you can feel their heat.
Destination?
Hotel district. The faintest sounds can be heard.  Almost sounds like music.
Security clearance approved. Welcome Tanner.  Enjoy your stay. Dropping down.  Into the lights.  Embraced by the colors.

It's as if someone took the best parts of the world's night spots and put them together in one neon-drenched city. Only this is the digital world. Picture-perfect architecture.  No pollution or decay.  An colors that are just a little bit more vibrant than the real world. Music pounds the air as crowds of people roam the streets exploring the countless pubs, casinos and night clubs.
Tanner heads down a street lined with some of the world's most famous hotels. Unlike the partying people all around him, Tanner is all business, staring straight ahead with laser-like intensity.
A group of INTERNAL COPS wearing tele-com's and Night Cit Police uniforms, stand huddled in the shadows across from The Savoy. The SERGEANT greets Tanner with a curt nod.
Corp must really want this guy to have sent the legend himself.
Just didn't want you boys having all the fun. The sergeant gives the signal.  The cops fan out.

The kid's still on the bed, sucking down a beer.  One of the Playmates leans over, lets him unhook her bra. He smiles at her overly perfect body. She bites her lip in staged ecstasy, tracing her fingers down his chest, pulling at his belt as -- The door burst open.  The cops and Tanner rush inside. The kid flies off the bed. A cop tries to grab him, only the kid grabs a chair and SMASHES it hard into the cop's face, dropping him hard to the floor --
The cop's real body lies strapped to an interface seat, twitching as the pain sears through his consciousness --
The other cops ready to charge, but Tanner gets in front of them, freezing the kid with a look.
Look, we're going to trace you. The confetti still swirling through the room.
So be smart about this --
-- You're the big man.  Big fucking cop. He laughs as he makes an imaginary 'gun' with his fingers and points it at Tanner --
No guns on the system.  That's how it's programmed, right? (pulls the 'trigger')
So what are you going to do, huh big cop?  Can't shoot me.
Look, I know you didn't run it.  You had keys. Kid shakes his head, full of bravado.
That maze's nothing.  I could run it blind on a sixty-meg board.
(whispers)
This is a waste of time.  How about a little encouragement?
Everyone in the room watching the scene playing out in th hotel.
Here's something which ought to help him talk -- Her fingers race over the console.
Tanner still has the kid pinned with his stare.
Fine, you ran it.  That's felony system fraud.  Gets you thirty years. (lets that sink-in)

Or you tell us where you got the keys and we start talking a deal. Kid's eyes reveal he's thinking this one through, only -- A huge DOBERMAN explodes through the window. Insane growl, deadly stare, rocketing for the Kid, who freaks, throwing one of the Virtual Playmates into its path -- Powerful claws rips through her, flinging her against the wall.  She lies there shredded, but for some reason, not bleeding. Kid throws himself out the window.  Doberman flies after him, with Tanner just a heartbeat behind.
The kid races down the crowded street with the Doberman chasing after him.
(yells)
Lose the God-Damn dog! A couple crosses the street, getting between the kid and the dog --
Emma slams in the commands --
The Doberman about to tear through the couple, but flickers, then disappears.
Slightly featureless waiters and waitresses deliver drinks.  On stage, a young Billy Holiday belts out a soulful blues tune. The kid tears through the room.
The cops rush into the casino.  But Tanner stays on the street, racing around the side of the building.
The casino is now up on the monitor.  Emma's eyes following the kid.
Grid eighteen.  Heading for exit six.
The cops charge across the casino, but unable to get to the kid before he bolts out the exit --
The kid comes flying out into the alley.  There's Tanner, bearing down on him. Kid takes off, running as fast as he can, turning the corner to --
The sprawling structure where people enter and exit Night City. A crush of excited customers pushing past the HOSTESS who welcomes them with programmed cheerfulness.
And don't miss The Tivoli, with fireworks every hour on the hour. (smiles)
And please remember to follow all safety rules while -- The kid racing through the crowd with Tanner in hot pursuit.
Sound of rock music bouncing off the buildings. The kid sprints out of the crowd and up and over a hill. Tanner follows, finding himself in the midst of --

A colored light show screaming down from the heavens. The huge crowd of people gyrating to the music pounding from the band on the river-front stage. Tanner pushes into the frenzy as an USHER quickly steps u to him.
(very politely)
I'm sorry sir, but there is a premium charge for this event -- Tanner pulls his ACCESS CARD from his pocket and runs it through the thin slot in the usher's torso.  A beat, before...
Access approved.  Enjoy the concert, Tanner. The usher steps away as Tanner slices through the crowd, eyes probing for the kid.
Where the hell is he?
Emma is studying the monitor, trying to find the kid in the churning sea of humanity --
I'm working on it.

The band finishes the song.  The audience yelling for mor as the light show suddenly snaps off -- Pitch blackness. A new song.  Even louder.  Audience screaming along as strobe lights rip through the night. Tanner trying to focus in the quick bursts of illumination.

He's north-east of you.  Heading to Crimson street -- Tanner spins, cutting a path through the throng.  Picking up speed.  But suddenly freezes -- A face.  KATIE.  Effortlessly attractive.  The warmest of smiles not quite able to hide the sadness. Her expensively dressed male companion's arm wrapped tightly around her waist as they watch the concert. Tanner stares at her.  Doing everything he can to hold it in. The lights strobing her face.  Tanner struggles to pull his eyes away.  Only now she looks over.  Sees him. They stare at each other for a long tortured beat. Katie turns to her companion, whispers something, then hurries over to Tanner.  Only he's no longer there. Her eyes spinning through the crowd.  Catches a glimpse o Tanner as he disappears into the darkness.
The kid breaks out of the concert crowd.  Races up the street and over a bridge to --

Modeled after Amsterdam.  Canal-lined streets brimming with businesses catering to every and any erotic desire. Kid comes running off the bridge and suddenly stops.  A pair of cops charging him.  The kid turns, rushing into -
Customers browse the ten stories worth of Virtual Playmates enclosed in small glass cubicles. The cops push through the crowd, racing after the kid.
Tanner sprints for the fire escape on the side of the building.

The kid racing for an exit, but can't find one.  The cops almost to him, so he bolts straight for a cubicle -- Covering his face, he throws himself through the glass, flying past the stunned Playmate and out the cubicle's back door --
The kid charges up the stairs to the top floor and out onto --
The kid throws the door shut behind him as --
Time to be smart. Kid spins.  Tanner is right there.
Not too late to cut a deal. (coaxing)

All you've got to do is tell me where you got -- The kid backs away from Tanner, but quickly runs out of roof, teetering on the edge of a ten story drop. A frozen beat, then the kid looks up at Tanner with a twisted grin.
(realizing)

But the kid's already laughing as he lets himself fall backward into the air. Tanner dives after him, smashing face-first into the roof grabbing the kid's foot before it disappears over the edge. He reels the kid back onto the roof, slamming his stare into him --
This isn't one of those virtual reality systems you're used to playing on! The kid shrugs, unfazed.
This is hyper-reality.  Full Immersion.
Big deal --
-- If you had come in through the gates like you were supposed to, you'd know. (intense)
Full Immersion.  You die on this system, your consciousness dies. The kid stares at Tanner as this sinks in.  But he still keeps up his tough guy look.
Why the hell do you care? Tanner wipes the blood from his chin as he rips all trace of compassion from his face, matching the kid's stare.
I don't.  I just need you alive so you can tell me where you got the keys. Tanner hurls the kid back into the arms of the waiting cops.
Trace him.
Be my pleasure. They drag the kid down the stairs, leaving Tanner alone o the roof, sound of music swirling through the darkness.

An engineer studying his screen as location grids flash by. One of the grids suddenly freezes. The engineer punches a command into his console, enlargin the grid to show a cross-section of city streets.
Tanner heads down the crowded street toward the flashing lights of the --

Tanner stands on the outskirts of the concert, staring into the area where he had seen Katie. The strobe lights flashing across his face. He finally forces himself to turn away from it, heading alone down the street,
(calls out)
Tanner. Frozen beat.  Katie steps from the shadows. A long, tortured silence.
Least you could do is say hello. He slowly looks at her.  Working hard to keep it under control.
Hello. This isn't easy for either of them.
What brings you inside?
Cleaning up a mess.
(small smile)
Some things never change, do they? Sees the dried blood on his chin.  Old reflexes taking over, she puts a soothing hand on his face. He stands rigid.  Barely breathing.  Forces himself to turn away.
I've got to get back.
Tanner. Her eyes plead into his.  Takes everything he's got to remain firm.
Sorry. He heads down the street.  She calls after him --
You know I wanted to tell you, but they wouldn't let me -- But he's already disappeared into the darkness.

The crowded joint watching as the late blues legend 'Howling Wolf', lets lose on stage. Tanner finds a spot at the bar and orders a drink, his eyes still dark with memories. The drink arrives.  As Tanner picks it up, a drop of bloo falls from his chin, crimson spot smearing through the amber liquid.
It's good luck.  Means your real. Tanner looks next to him at -- GENA, sexy, chatty, sense of longing.  She motions to the employees.
The programs don't bleed. Tanner nods, waits a polite beat, then turns back around, taking a hit of his drink, but she's still talking to him
Where you plugged-in from?
(beat)
New York.
I'm South Dakota. She sips from her drink, eyes still on Tanner.
That's what you gotta love about this place.  Drink whatever you want, your real body doesn't gain an once. (beat)
But you wanna know what's a drag? He drains his drink and motions for a refill.
What?
The weather.
Christoph stands outside, watching them through the window.
Gena leans in toward Tanner.
Always a warm summer night.  Which is a shame, because there's nothing like making love in the rain. (flirty)
Don't you agree? He looks at her, not sure how to respond.  She reads the silence.
(disappointed)
What's her name?
Who?
The woman you're stuck on.
(quiet)
There is no -- His tele-com buzzing, then Emma's voice in his ear.
Nailed the trace.  Kid's in Memphis. Tanner talks into the tele-com.
Good, kick him out.
You sure?  We can handle collection.
Emma is watching Tanner and Gena on a monitor.
I mean, I don't want to interrupt anything --
-- You're not.  Kick me out. Emma shrugs, turns to the console.
Tanner motions the bartender to refill Gena's drink, tossing down credit to cover it.
Take care.
Take care?  Where the hell are you going -- He flickers, then disappears into --

The last thing Tanner sees is Gena's insulted face blurring into the swerve of lights bending into each othe as -- Tanner is pulled out into the blackness of the net. Eternal silence.  Finally -- A shaft of light slices the darkness. Eerie green glow, the echoing sound of an electronic heartbeat. Struggling to make out images.  A line smearing up and down.
Tanner blinking back to consciousness.  The weaving line is on the bio-monitor tracking his vitals. A bored technician unplugs him from the monitor.

Just lay there a few minutes. But Tanner forces himself to get up.  His chin shows no sign of the wound received in the digital world. He looks around groggily at the sea of motionless people plugged into the system.  Place feels like a morgue.
Christoph moves straight for the now-empty seat next to Gena.

First light streaks peacefully through the windows. The place is sparsely furnished.  Empty beer kegs are use as chairs and textbooks lie scattered about. The stillness is shattered as -- The front door explodes open -- Heavily armored MEMPHIS SWAT TEAM rushing in, along with Dex and a couple of VSI security guys -- Weapons drawn, everybody's dead serious. Tanner follows them in, watching as they rip through the place, kicking in doors, searching everything, until finally --
(from basement)
Down here! Everyone rushes down into --

The kid lies unconscious on a cot, his fingers stuck in a connect-box wired to an old laptop computer. Swat team leader starts to pull the kid up off the cot, but Dex's hand shoots out, stopping him --
Bad idea. Dex whips a mini-cell phone from his pocket.  Swat leader turns a confused eye to Tanner.
Pull him off the system before he's ejected and he goes brain dead.
We got him.  Kick him lose.
The kid is sitting in the middle of a black cube.  He suddenly flickers, then disappears --
The kid's body twitches.  Eyes fluttering open.  First impulse is to run, but as his focus sharpens -- A wall of laser guns trained on his face.
Christoph settles into the seat next to Gena.  He orders drink, then turns his attention to her.
Might I interest you in a question? She turns, gives him the once over, then flashes him a playful smile.
As long as it's not 'what's your sign?'
If you could meet God, what would you say to him? She stares at him.  He's serious.
That's a strange question.  You a strange man?
There you are, sitting next to the creator, what do you say?
(amazed laugh)
This is how you pick up women --
-- No. The intensity in his stare unsettles her.  But something about it keeps her from moving away.  She looks at him, shrugging.
I'd probably say something like why'd you let the world get so fucked-up? He nods, eyes aching with compassion.
Your life that bad?
No, not me, I've been lucky.  But I've seen what happens to other people --
-- If your life's so good up there Gena, what are you doing down here? She stares at him.
How'd you know my name? His drink arrives as he calmly meets her stare.
Do you believe in miracles?
I'm serious, how did you know my name? He smiles, dangerous charm.
(toasting)
To miracles. She's still staring at him, not exactly sure what to make of this guy, but intrigued enough to join him in the toast.
The storm has finally arrived.  The jet-copter slashing through the dark rain.
Tanner is holed up in the back with the kid's laptop computer.  Programs racing down the screen. He stops on a program, eyes blazing in vindication.
Flawless gothic architecture complete with Gargoyles growing down from the roof. The building is dark and seemingly empty save for the outdoor glass elevator climbing up its side.
Gena and Christoph stand next to each other in the elevator, staring down through the window at the firework raining over --

Night City's digital carnival. A roller coaster with no track, cars rocketing through thin air over a merry-go-around with real horses. The carnival is surrounded by The Track, where people rac Ferrari's at full speed. One of the cars loses control, hurtling toward the wall, but freezes at the last second to allow the driver to climb out unhurt --

Gena turns, catching the flicker of almost child-like awe in Christoph's eyes as he looks out over Night City. She smiles, moving a little closer to him.  The elevator glides to a stop.  He looks at her.
You were right.
(beat)
About what? The doors open and he leads her out onto --
A brass bed surrounded by unlit candles sits in the midst of the elegantly designed roof garden.
Making love in the rain. She looks from the bed to him, confused.

But it doesn't rain here -- The first raindrops beginning to fall as -- Sultry jazz music envelopes them.  The candle wicks crackle to life, flames dancing in the night. Gena's stunned, shaking her head, insisting.

It can't rain here.  Not the way it's programmed. Her eyes dart out over the roof.  It's not raining anywhere else.  Just here on the roof.  Just on them. She stares at him, fascination mixed with fear.
Who are you?!
(quietly)
Someone who believes in miracles. He pulls her to him, warm rain caressing their bodies.
The jet-copter twists down through the rain for a landing

Halden's office is on the top floor of the building, windows offering up God's eye view of the storm battered Manhattan. Tanner marches in and before Halden can react, slams a mini-disk into the wall player. A matrix of data swirls down the wall monitor.
Recognize it? Halden's silent.  Tanner's stare digging into him.
Kid had keys. (matter-of-fact)
The maze is unrunnable. Halden is still silent, a sour eye on the monitor.
Doesn't make sense.  How the hell does some fucking teenager get to the keys?
Sorry, I just design the maze. (tight smile)
Keeping the keys secure is your job. He turns for the door as the monitor buzzes, now showing --

The kid sits like a statue in his chair.  He doesn't look up as the VSI LAWYER enters and takes a seat across from him. The lawyer stares at the kid as if this could somehow mak him break down and confess.  Finally...
Care to tell us how you came into possession of an illegal access program?
Look, I'm doing mute 'till I have a mouthpiece here who's on my side.
You don't need a lawyer. (holds up the disk)
We found the program on your laptop.
Tanner has stopped in the doorway, his eyes on the monitor --
The kid stares impassively at the lawyer.
Don't know what you're talking about.
Of course you do. (dead serious)
And the only shot you've got of keeping your ass from sinking in a sea of shit is to tell me where you got this program. The kid shakes his head, laughing.
What's so funny?
This.  No point to it.
Why not?
Because you'll never believe me.
Try me. The kid slowly stops laughing, his voice seemingly genuine.
It was just there.
There?
My uni-net account.  I log on.  The program's there.
Just like that?
Just like that --
Halden is still watching at the monitor, not noticing as Tanner turns and silently slips out into --
The voices playing from the monitor are just barely audible as Tanner heads down the long hallway.
Any idea how the program got there?
How the hell do I know?  Maybe it was a gift from God?
Rain streaming down on Christoph and Gena as they have sex. She studies him.  His eyes are burning with intensity, savoring each and every sensation.
You don't have much sex up there in the real world, do you?
(barely audible)
No... Hard to tell if it's rain or tears which streak down his face.
Tanner moves through the dark rain and into the waiting -
Tanner climbs in, practically having to yell to be heard over the storm.
Ninth and Hudson. The PILOT punches it up on the nav-board.  The location popping-up on the grid.
Hell's Kitchen.  Talk about your shit holes.  What's there?
My home. Takes the pilot a full beat to realize Tanner isn't joking.
(trying to cover)

Cheap rents.  Close to the waterfront.  I hear the area's making a comeback. He quickly turns his attention to engaging the thrusters. Tanner stares straight ahead, watching the rain slam into the windshield.
It has stopped raining.  Gena lies asleep on the bed.  Sh is alone.

Thrusters groaning to life.  High-pitched whine, almost sounding like laughter. Tanner is watching the blasts of rain battering the windows. The jet-copter twisting up into the sky. A rain drop zig-zags across the windshield, running into another droplet, making one single, bigger drop racing down the glass. Tanner staring at the windshield.  Suddenly realizing --
Land it.
Sir?
Take me back down. Pilot shrugs, floats the copter back down to the roof.
Tanner rushes through the control room to Emma.
I need playback on the kid's run. She reads the urgency in his voice and pulls it up --
A holographic image of the maze.  The glowing blue square racing through it, accompanied by the unmistakable sound of laughter.
Freeze it. (she does)
Now pull-up play-back of the kid's interrogation. A beat.  The maze replaced by VSI'S interrogation room.
Don't know what you're talking about.
Of course you do.  And the only shot you've got of keeping your ass from sinking in a sea of shit is to tell me where you got this program. The kid starts laughing.
Freeze it -- The lawyer and the kid suddenly motionless.
Tanner staring at the kid's frozen image on the monitor.

Can you isolate and voice-print the last sixty audio-bits of both play- backs? Emma punches in the command. The sound of the kid's laughing, playing alongside the sound of laughter from the maze run. Tanner staring at the voice prints on the audio-board.
Better get Halden down here.
Christoph hurries down the street, the sound of nearby partying echoing all around him. He turns the corner, finding himself in a --
A holographic map of Night City shimmers in front of him.
You are here. (a red X glows on the map)
To reach the club district simply turn around and head east on Crimson Street. (dotted lines show the path)

To reach the Mardi Gras, simply -- Christoph reaches through the holograph, sliding an acces card into an all but invisible slot in the wall. The map disappears as the wall slides open.  Christoph heads through the opening --
Christoph's voice echoing through the blackness.
Lights. The lights snap on, revealing Christoph standing at the entrance of a long utility tunnel which snakes down under the ground.
Halden, Dex, and Tanner watch as Emma plays back the maze run.
That's the runner's laugh. Emma plays back the kid's interrogation.  The kid laughing.
That's the kid's laugh. (beat)
We ran voice-print.  It's not the same person. Everyone stares at him.
Christoph sprints through the tunnel.  It winds around into --

A large room full of reserve employees. Motionless waiters, bartenders, playmates and bellhops stacked along long racks, staring out into space with empty eyes. Christoph races through the room to the stairs in the back.
Halden still staring at Tanner, realizing --
Two maze runners.
(nods)
Someone sends the kid a copy of the access program, then runs the maze at the same time the kid does, using the same codes.
Why?
Because that way, the system only registers a single runner. (beat)
We go after the kid, leaving the other person free and clear to do whatever the hell they want. A long terrified beat for this to sink in.
Christoph rushes down the stairs and into --
A pair of GUARDS stand sentry in front of a large door.
Need to see your work orders, sir -- Christoph nods, slamming his fist into the guard's wind- pipe with deadly force, then spins, snapping the second guard's neck.

Blackness of the void. A blink of a light.  Colorless.  Racing into the maze -- An explosion of color and shapes hurtling all around with blurring speed -- The engineer navigates around the first corner, cutting a safe path, the "keys" seeming to be working, only -- Suddenly everything shifting.  Get the hell out of there. Only behind him, the maze morphing -- Dizzying design of color.  Breath-taking beauty.  Closing in on him.  Nowhere to run -- Flash of bright light. The rain has started to slow. The assault team's outside, smoking cigarettes, bullshitting with each other, trying to forget what they saw in there, as --
Tanner probes through Christoph's blood stained computer. Stops on a program.  Complex codes flashing down the screen.
